## Jack Royle, PhD

## Employment

### University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Canada  
**Postdoctoral Fellow** (2024–Present)

- Led integrative analyses linking plant productivity, soil microbial communities, and ecosystem function in Canadian grasslands.
- Developed and maintained bioinformatic pipelines for processing large-scale genomic sequencing datasets.
- Coordinated province-wide data collection and management as part of Genome Canada-funded research.
- Contributed to collaborative scientific publications, grant writing and reporting, and interdisciplinary research outputs.
- Mentored and supervised undergraduate and graduate students.

### Australian Genome Research Facility, Brisbane, Australia  

**R&D Scientist** (2023–2024)

- Identified and implemented new protocols, with a focus on long-read sequencing platforms (PacBio).
- Developed costings and supported financial decisions regarding cost recovery.
- Monitored technical advancements and developed opportunities for new services and efficiency improvements.
- Implemented bioinformatic analysis pipelines, focusing on microbial, metagenomic, and pan-genomic tools.
- Worked with external collaborators to identify research projects with ongoing service potential.
- Presented at scientific conferences.

**Technical Officer** (2022–2023)

- Managed projects spanning library preparation, sequencing, and delivery of PacBio data and analyses to clients.
- Pioneered AWS infrastructure for cloud-based processing of long-read bioinformatic analyses.
- Produced client-facing reports and SOPs; supported project design and communication.
- Trained new staff to proficiency aligned with SOPs and NATA accreditation guidelines.

**Senior Laboratory Technician, Custom SNP Genotyping** (2021–2022)

- Designed and analysed custom SNP genotyping panels on the Agena MassARRAY platform.
- Spearheaded introduction of qPCR and TaqMan assays as a commercial service.

**Laboratory Technician, Sanger Sequencing** (2018–2021)
